description:
I have built devstack multinode setup on ocata release. Unable to launch any instances. All the instances are stuck into "scheduling" state. The only error in n-api log is:

n-api.log:1720:2017-03-14 11:48:59.805 25488 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-9a0f533b-b5af-4061-9b88-d00012762131 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1730:2017-03-14 11:49:21.641 25488 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-5bdcd955-ddec-4283-9b07-ccd1221912b5 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1740:2017-03-14 11:49:26.659 25488 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-8f9e858b-d80a-4770-a727-f94dcebcc986 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1816:2017-03-14 11:49:48.611 25487 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-da86d769-49d7-4eec-b389-0dca123b7e16 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1899:2017-03-14 11:51:04.481 25487 INFO nova.api.openstack.ws

n-sch has no error log.

o/p: of service list

stack@stack:~$ nova service-list
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/novaclient/client.py:278: UserWarning: The 'tenant_id' argument is deprecated in Ocata and its use may result in errors in future releases. As 'project_id' is provided, the 'tenant_id' argument will be ignored.
  warnings.warn(msg)
+----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+
| Id | Binary           | Host  | Zone     | Status  | State | Updated_at                 | Disabled Reason |
+----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+
| 3  | nova-conductor   | stack | internal | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:38.000000 | -               |
| 5  | nova-scheduler   | stack | internal | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:37.000000 | -               |
| 6  | nova-consoleauth | stack | internal | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:44.000000 | -               |
| 7  | nova-compute     | nfp   | nova     | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:38.000000 | -               |
+----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+
title: Instance stuck in schedule state in Ocata release

comments.content:
I have built devstack multinode setup on ocata release. Unable to launch any instances. All the instances are stuck into "scheduling" state. The only error in n-api log is:

n-api.log:1720:2017-03-14 11:48:59.805 25488 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-9a0f533b-b5af-4061-9b88-d00012762131 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1730:2017-03-14 11:49:21.641 25488 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-5bdcd955-ddec-4283-9b07-ccd1221912b5 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1740:2017-03-14 11:49:26.659 25488 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-8f9e858b-d80a-4770-a727-f94dcebcc986 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1816:2017-03-14 11:49:48.611 25487 ERROR nova.compute.api [req-da86d769-49d7-4eec-b389-0dca123b7e16 vks vks] No cells are configured, unable to list instances
n-api.log:1899:2017-03-14 11:51:04.481 25487 INFO nova.api.openstack.ws

n-sch has no error log.

o/p: of service list

stack@stack:~$ nova service-list
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/novaclient/client.py:278: UserWarning: The 'tenant_id' argument is deprecated in Ocata and its use may result in errors in future releases. As 'project_id' is provided, the 'tenant_id' argument will be ignored.
  warnings.warn(msg)
+----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+
| Id | Binary           | Host  | Zone     | Status  | State | Updated_at                 | Disabled Reason |
+----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+
| 3  | nova-conductor   | stack | internal | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:38.000000 | -               |
| 5  | nova-scheduler   | stack | internal | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:37.000000 | -               |
| 6  | nova-consoleauth | stack | internal | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:44.000000 | -               |
| 7  | nova-compute     | nfp   | nova     | enabled | up    | 2017-03-14T07:21:38.000000 | -               |
+----+------------------+-------+----------+---------+-------+----------------------------+-----------------+
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vikash-kumar

comments.content:
have you took a look at this doc 
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/cells.html?

there are a set of steps might need to be done?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jichenjc

comments.content:
None of the nova log files suggests any issue here. Below is the scheduler log, when instance is launched 
http://paste.openstack.org/show/602635/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vikash-kumar

comments.content:
Have the same error when trying to launch an instance in Ocata which I installed following latest Ocata guide: https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/install-guide-ubuntu

/var/log/nova/nova-api.log:
ERROR nova.compute.api [req-0641f2bb-0c91-464d-9ea3-b14654917658 f67f7592c73e45d8a70fab2406e895e8 388f2cb3b9b846ccb873c1fe06f3bd36 - default default] No cells are configured, unable to list instances

The instance is stuch in this state:
+--------------------------------------+------------+--------+------------+-------------+----------+
| ID                                   | Name       | Status | Task State | Power State | Networks |
+--------------------------------------+------------+--------+------------+-------------+----------+
| f3b5e111-5f06-4fe8-9458-70dba2d5a6ca | instance01 | BUILD  | scheduling | NOSTATE     |          |
+--------------------------------------+------------+--------+------------+-------------+----------+
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~flashcoder

comments.content:
The missed steps are documented here:

https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/cells.html#first-time-setup

That should get you a cell record created, hosts discovered, and back on track.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~danms
